text: could we talk about the next steps related to error handling?
it would be good if everybody could review it and tell his/her opinion
<@U0KM61BCP> <@U0KN2SSKE> could you have a look and post some comments about your thoughts (on the issue)?
<@U0KM61BCP> please review discussion above about handling merge commits in a way similar to other projects - allowing committers to propose them
<@U0KM61BCP> if we move forward with that, it’s just another knob I need to turn when we bring up projects
you can look at lf-sandbox to see where I’ve made a bunch of commits that would work as proposed
feel free to check them out and do a gitk or whatever you use to see the graph
so it would be limited to maintainers?

yes. the only change is that maintainers will be allowed to upload merges for review. this will make keeping branches up with master easier. however it will require more diligence on the part of maintainers to prevent reverse or mis-targeted merges
cbf which projects should we have this on? I assume only fabric to start, since it’s really the only project with velocity?
